MS MCQs

    Get started with Azure Advisor

    »

    1. Azure Advisor provides recommendations for _____.

      Costs and security only

      Reliability, security, performance, operational excellence, and cost

      Reliability, performance, and cost


    2. After you select an Advisor recommendation, you can choose to _____.

      Postpone the recommendation and deal with it later

      Follow the link to take steps to resolve the issue

      Dismiss the recommendation all together so it doesn’t show up again

      All of the above


    3. What is the highest possible Advisor Score you can receive in any of the five categories that Advisor checks?

      10, since the Advisor score is based on a scale of 1 to 10.

      20\%, since all five categories added together create a maximum best score of 100\%.

      100\%, since you can score 100\% in each of the five categories.


    4. Which of these actions is not recommended as part of a good general workflow for how to manage your Advisor Score?

      If your Advisor Score falls below your target goal, analyze the category scores to see what is most in need of addressing.

      Apply the Advisor recommendations that will get you back to your goal as quickly as possible.

      Ignore the category score impact for each recommendation since it’s not really necessary.


    5. What is the difference between Advisor Alerts and Advisor Recommendation Digests?

      Alerts periodically send you a summary of all your active recommendations while Recommendation Digests only notify you when a new recommendation is available.

      Alerts only notify you when a new recommendation is available while Recommendation Digests periodically send you a summary of all your active recommendations.

      Nothing. There’s essentially no difference between the two.
